title: Prize-winner claim portal with identity verification and admin management dashboard

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and role-gated navigation with two main areas: (1) Winner Portal for standard authenticated users and (2) Admin Dashboard accessible only to configured admin principals.

quotes: a place for me to manage all the winners activities on the app

acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in using Internet Identity.
Non-admin users cannot access any Admin Dashboard routes/pages (UI hides links; backend also rejects admin-only calls).
At least one admin principal can be configured (e.g., via backend constant/list) to unlock admin-only features.

requirements.text: Create the Winner Portal flow to verify a prize-winner ticket and activate a winning prize number, including clear status feedback (valid/invalid/already claimed) and preventing the same winning entry from being activated by multiple accounts.
acceptanceCriteria: Winner can enter a ticket identifier/code and a prize number (or activation code) and submit for verification.
Backend returns a deterministic status: valid + activated for this user, invalid, or already activated by someone else.
Once activated, the activation is bound to the signed-in principal and is not re-claimable by another principal.

requirements.text: Add a winner claim submission form that collects required prize delivery details and claim information, and supports selecting a payout method: ATM card, certified check, or bank transfer, with conditional fields per method.

quotes: To chose method to receive prize with which are atm card ,certified check or bank transfer
fill in details for prize delivery

acceptanceCriteria: Winner can select one of: ATM card, certified check, bank transfer.
Form dynamically shows required fields for the chosen method (e.g., bank transfer requires bank details; check requires mailing name/address).
Winner can save/submit the claim; backend stores it and returns a claim ID.
Winner can view the current claim status after submission (e.g., Draft/Submitted/Under Review/Approved/Rejected/Need More Info).

requirements.text: Implement identity verification capture in the Winner Portal: allow the winner to take/upload a selfie and an ID card photo, attach them to a claim, and submit for review with basic client-side validation and backend size/type limits.

quotes:
a place where winner can click on to take
Selfie and id card for self verification

acceptanceCriteria: Winner can capture/upload two images: selfie and ID card photo.
Client enforces basic validation (file type image/* and reasonable max size) and shows previews before upload.
Backend stores the uploaded images associated with the claim (or an upload record linked to the claim).
Winner can re-upload/replace images while the claim is not in a finalized state (e.g., before approval).

requirements.text: Add a winner-facing confirmation/legitimacy page that lets users submit their prize claim and see a clear confirmation that the submission was received, plus a simple “Is this real?” information section with plain-English guidance and disclaimers.

quotes: where they can click on to submit the prize claim from the prize winners coming to the app to testify if it’s real

acceptanceCriteria: After submitting a claim, the winner sees a confirmation screen with claim ID and current status.
An “Is this real?” section is accessible from the Winner Portal and contains English-only explanatory text and safety disclaimers.
The page does not imply endorsement by any real public figure or government entity.

requirements.text: Create an Admin Dashboard to manage winners’ activities: list claims, filter by status, view claim details (including delivery info, payout method, and uploaded selfie/ID images), and allow the admin to respond and update claim status (e.g., request more info, approve, reject).

quotes: a place for me to manage all the winners activities on the app and where I can respond to the details filled for the prize claim

acceptanceCriteria: Admin can view a table/list of all claims with key fields (claim ID, user, status, created date).
Admin can open a claim detail view and see submitted data and uploaded images.
Admin can set claim status and add an admin message/response visible to the winner.
All admin actions are enforced by backend authorization checks.

requirements.text: Add a Testimonials section with motivational “past winner talks” content items (including the provided names) displayed in the app, and build simple admin tooling to add/edit/remove testimonials so the content can be managed over time.

quotes: some professional motivational lottery talks from past winners like Ronnie  lee from USA  and Hans Cusveller from Canada  who won $750,000,00 each with a brand new truck

acceptanceCriteria: Winner Portal includes a Testimonials page/section listing testimonial items (name, country, message).
Initial seed testimonials include entries for “Ronnie Lee (USA)” and “Hans Cusveller (Canada)” as editable content.
Admin can add/edit/delete testimonial entries from the Admin Dashboard.
UI includes a disclaimer indicating testimonials are user-submitted/marketing content and may not be independently verified.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, layout) suitable for a prize-claim portal, ensuring accessibility and consistent styling across Winner Portal and Admin Dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: App uses a consistent palette, typography scale, and spacing system across pages.
Forms, buttons, tables, and alerts use consistent variants and states (hover/disabled/error).
Color contrast meets basic accessibility expectations for primary text on backgrounds.

requirements.text: Implement backend data models and stable storage for: winning entries (tickets/prize numbers), claims (delivery + payout method details), identity uploads (selfie/ID), admin responses, and testimonials; expose typed Motoko APIs for the frontend to create/read/update these entities.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides methods for winner actions: verify/activate, create/update/submit claim, upload/re-upload identity images, get own claim(s) and status, read testimonials.
Backend provides admin-only methods: list all claims, get claim details, update claim status + response, manage testimonials, and (if needed) manage winning entries.
All persisted state survives canister upgrade using stable variables (no migration file unless required by later schema changes).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).

Do not modify files under frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose these components instead).
Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not include or display political-figure images or any content that could mislead users into thinking a real public figure endorsed or announced the promotion.
nonGoals: Integrating third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.
Real-time chat, push notifications, SMS, or email delivery integrations.
Using external databases or non-Motoko backend services.
Adding or embedding the user-requested Trump/political-figure images as “proof” of announcing the lottery promotion.

required: Generic lottery promotion banner with abstract celebratory elements (lottery-banner.dim_1600x600.png)
Badge-style seal illustration reading “Prize Claim Portal” (claim-seal.dim_512x512.png)
